intro: Ancistragrostis uncinioides, commonly known as the hooked hairgrass, is a flowering plant species native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, spikelet-based flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its common name. Ancistragrostis uncinioides is typically found in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
